properties.Name: 26th June, 1940
properties.description: 4 High Explosive bombs are dropped on Tullos Home Farm at Nigg without incident.

properties.Name: 30th June, 1940
properties.description: Approximately 20 Incendiary Bombs are dropped in the area around Greyhope Road and Wood Street at 35 minutes past Midnight.

properties.Name: 30th June, 1940
properties.description: 2 High Explosive Bombs are dropped in this area.

properties.Name: 30th June, 1940
properties.description: Many Incendiary bombs fall on the Torry district of town - the Fiddes Woodyard on Crombie Road is recorded as being hit by "few" incendiary bombs. Victoria Road school is burned out completely, and Lookout Post 2 on the roof of the school is destroyed. The attack begins at 11:45 PM, and the All Clear is signalled at 1:20 AM on the morning of the 1st of July.

properties.Name: 12th July, 1940
properties.description: Enemy aircraft appeared suddenly with no warning at 12:45 PM and launched an attack on the Hall Russell shipyards. Approximately 16 High Explosive bombs are dropped on Hall Russell, with the majority hitting the Boiler Works. A High Explosive bomb also hits the London Boat at Waterloo Quay. 25 bodies are brought to the ARP Emergency Mortuary at Berryden Road.

properties.Name: 12th July, 1940
properties.description: A Heinkel Light Bomber tasked to attack Leuchars is shot down by RAF 603 Squadron and crashes into the Aberdeen Ice Rink.

properties.Name: 12th July, 1940
properties.description: Bomb Splinter Damage reported on Spa Street.

properties.Name: 12th July, 1940
properties.description: 3 High Explosive bombs are dropped on Urquhart Road, as well as two on properties in Roslin Terrace. Unexploded bombs are found on the railway line close to the King Street Bridge.

properties.Name: 12th July, 1940
properties.description: One High Explosive bomb hits Castlehill Barracks.

properties.Name: 12th July, 1940
properties.description: 9 High Explosive bombs fall on the area around Regent Walk and King Street. One is noted as striking Hogg's Granite Yard.

properties.Name: 13th August, 1940
properties.description:
An attack comes without warning at 10:50 PM. Trinity Cemetery is hit with an Incendiary bomb, as well as a High Explosive bomb. The latter does not detonate.
A High Explosive bomb also falls on a residence in Seaforth Road, and one High Explosive and one Incendiary fall on the Park Road Court end of Golf Road.
A bomb falls somewhere "about Pittodrie". It does not detonate, and its location is not verified.

properties.Name: 13th August, 1940
properties.description: High Explosive bombs strike 200 yards West of the entrance to the Torry Battery.

properties.Name: 28th August, 1940
properties.description: High Explosive and Incendiary bombs are dropped on the shore at Nigg at 45 minutes past Midnight.

properties.Name: 28th August, 1940
properties.description: 1 High Explosive bomb falls on a residence in Forbesfield Road.

properties.Name: 28th August, 1940
properties.description: A bomb crater is discovered in Hazlehead, near the "Old Garden".

properties.Name: 28th August, 1940
properties.description: 10 High Explosive bombs fall on the area of Pitfodels along the North Deeside Road between Woodbank House and The Ridge.

properties.Name: 29th September, 1940
properties.description: 13 High Explosive bombs fall on Torry at 9:30 PM, striking residences in Oscar Place, Oscar Road, Grampian Road, Walker Lane, Walker road, South Esplanade West, the Co-operative buildings in Menzies Road and the Torry Library.

properties.Name: 29th September, 1940
properties.description: High Explosive bomb hits "The School in Nelson Street".

properties.Name: 29th September, 1940
properties.description: Two High Explosive bombs fall on King Street by the School of Domestic Science; a third bomb falls on Seaforth Road.

properties.Name: 28th October, 1940
properties.description: A bomb is dropped in the sea in front of the bathing station at Queen's Links at 9:56 PM.

properties.Name: 31st October, 1940
properties.description: High Explosive bomb falls on the Broad Hill close to the Beach Ballroom.

properties.Name: 31st October, 1940
properties.description:
High Explosive Bomb falls between Broad Hill and Park Road.
High Explosive Bomb falls in McLeod's Yard on Urquhart Road near Broad Hill.

properties.Name: 31st October, 1940
properties.description: High Explosive Bomb falls on east side of Trinity Cemetery.

properties.Name: 31st October, 1940
properties.description: High Explosive bombs strike the Bowling Green in Berryden Road as well as railway sheds.

properties.Name: 3rd November, 1940
properties.description: High Explosive bomb falls somewhere on a farm in Bucksburn.

properties.Name: 3rd November, 1940
properties.description: An incident of unknown nature is reported from Airy Hall on Craigton Road - the type of bomb is not identified.

properties.Name: 3rd November, 1940
properties.description: 2 High Explosive bombs fall on Pitfodels House.

properties.Name: 3rd November, 1940
properties.description: A High Explosive bomb falls on Springhill Road.

properties.Name: 4th November, 1940
properties.description: High Explosive bomb was dropped on Harper's at Craigshaw.

properties.Name: 4th November, 1940
properties.description: Bombs fall on sawmills at Wellington Road. Register omits type and quantity.

properties.Name: 4th November, 1940
properties.description: High explosive bomb falls near Bridge of Dee.

properties.Name: 5th November, 1940
properties.description: 2 High Explosive bombs are dropped in the area of Rubislaw Park Road and on 189 Queen's Road. There are reports of bombs dropped on the Beach Ballroom; these prove to be inaccurate.

properties.Name: 5th February, 1941
properties.description: 2 High Explosive bombs are dropped in the west of Northfield.

properties.Name: 13th February, 1941
properties.description: 2 High Explosive bombs and one Incendiary bomb fall on Loch Street, destroying McBride's Bar and 89 Loch Street.

properties.Name: 13th February, 1941
properties.description: 2 High Explosive bombs fall on 75 Hutcheon Street, one of which fails to detonate.

properties.Name: 13th February, 1941
properties.description: 2 High Explosive bombs fall on Victoria Dock, one of which fails to detonate.

properties.Name: 6th April, 1941
properties.description: High Explosive bomb strikes the landward end of the South Breakwater.

properties.Name: 20th April, 1941
properties.description: 2 High explosive bombs fall in the Gallows Hill and Park Road area.

properties.Name: 6th June, 1941
properties.description: 2 High Explosive bombs fall on Torry Battery; 2 more fall on the nearby Greyhope Cottages.

properties.Name: 9th July, 1941
properties.description: 3 High Explosive bombs are dropped on Marischal Street, Regent Quay, Pontoon Dock 2 of Albert Quay, Clyde Street, and the Lime Company buildings on Blaikie's Quay as well as Lookout Post 10 - for which no location is given.

properties.Name: 21st July, 1941
properties.description: 3 High Explosive bombs fall, hitting the East end of Commercial Quay near the North Eastern Ice Company building, as well as Marischal Street near Regent Quay, properties in the Castle street and Justice Street area, and the Caledonian Milling Company store. Other bombs fall but do not explode and are later removed.

properties.Name: 24th July, 1940
properties.description: High explosive bomb falls on the junction between Clifton Road and Hilton Road.

properties.Name: 24th July, 1941
properties.description: High Explosive bomb falls on Don Place at 1:30 AM.

properties.Name: 24th July, 1941
properties.description: High Explosive bomb strikes the junction between Summer Place and Brown Street.

properties.Name: 24th July, 1941
properties.description: High Explosive bomb falls on 371 Great Northern Road.

properties.Name: 2nd August, 1941
properties.description: High explosive bomb falls at junction of Auchinyell Road and Garthdee Road (referred to as "Garthdee Farm Road" in register).

properties.Name: 2nd August, 1941
properties.description: 2 High Explosive bombs fall into a field near Garthdee farm.

properties.Name: 2nd August, 1941
properties.description: One bomb falls on the north side of Auchinyell road, but does not explode.

properties.Name: 5th August, 1941
properties.description: 3 High Explosive bombs fall at the Northern Co-operative Society building on Stell Road as well as the Police Cleansing Department on Poynernook Road. A bomb falls 15 yards from the main entrance of W. Hay & Sons Metal Merchants in Poynernook road, but does not explode.

properties.Name: 8th August, 1941
properties.description: Air attack begins at 8 minutes past Midnight with a High Explosive bomb falling on Menzies Road at the junction with Victoria Road. One person is killed in the attack.

properties.Name: 8th August, 1941
properties.description: High Explosive Bomb falls on Northern Co-operative store building on North Esplanade East.

properties.Name: 8th August, 1941
properties.description: High Explosive Bomb falls on South Esplanade East, along with a report of an unexploded bomb which is later cancelled.

properties.Name: 18th August, 1941
properties.description: Ten alerts are given without result during the period of the 8th to the 18th August. At 10 PM on the 18th, 2 High Explosive bombs fall on Grandholm Grove - at the time, this was Bannermill Road. One person is killed in the attack.

properties.Name: 18th August, 1941
properties.description: 1 High Explosive bomb falls on 27 Cotton Street.

properties.Name: 11th September, 1941
properties.description: 2 High Explosive bombs are dropped in the mouth of the River Don at 3:30 PM.

properties.Name: 22nd November, 1941
properties.description:
High Explosive Bomb falls on the promenade at Links Street, at 9:10 AM after an alert during which no activity took place at 4 AM that morning.
A second HE bomb falls on the beach end of Neptune Terrace.

properties.Name: 25th April, 1942
properties.description: Air attack begins at 10:55 PM. 4 High Explosive bombs fall on the City - one bomb damages buildings at the junction of Summerfield Terrace and King Street.

properties.Name: 25th April, 1942
properties.description: Damage is reported from a High Explosive bomb on houses at King Street near Urquhart Road.

properties.Name: 25th April, 1942
properties.description: A High Explosive Bomb falls on Lawson's Drapers and Clothiers at 190 George Street.

properties.Name: 25th April, 1942
properties.description: High Explosive bomb falls at Seamount Place; noted as damaging a church by the Gallowgate "near the Lads Club".

properties.Name: 25th April, 1942
properties.description: 4 High Explosive bombs fall on the area of Hillhead Road and Westerton Farm - one does not explode and is later defused.

properties.Name: 7th August, 1942
properties.description: Air attack noted at 10:26 PM. One High Explosive bomb falls on Raik Road.

properties.Name: 7th August, 1942
properties.description: High Explosive bomb dropped on Caledonian Mills at Palmerston Road.

properties.Name: 7th August, 1942
properties.description: Damage is sustained by High Explosive bomb at Labour Exchange and fish market.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description:
The most prolonged air attack against Aberdeen takes place at 10:17 PM on the 21st of April, 1943. Over 130 individually noted explosive devices fall on Aberdeen, including High Explosive, Phosphorus, and cluster sub-munitions.
A cluster bomb carrying 50 sub-bombs detonates over Catherine Street.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 1 500 KG High Explosive bomb falls on Charles Street.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 1 500 KG High Explosive bomb falls on Fraser Place.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: Cluster Bomb submunitions and 1 Phosphorus bomb fall here on George Street.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 1 500 KG High Explosive bomb causes damage to Powis Place and Causewayend Church, as well as to houses in Charles Street.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 500 KG High Explosive bomb falls on Elmbank Road.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 500 KG High Explosive bomb falls on Bedford Place.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 500 KG High Explosive bomb falls next to two houses on Erskine Street.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 500 KG High Explosive bomb falls on Bedford Road.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 500 KG High Explosive bomb falls on Bedford Road.

properties.Name: 21st April 1943
properties.description: 50 SBC Cluster bombs fall in front of and behind a house in Erskine Street. One lands in the garden, fails to detonate, and later has to be removed with submunitions still intact.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943.
properties.description: Phosphorus bomb lands on the roof of a house in Erskine Street and fails to detonate.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 50 KG High Explosive bomb falls on Robert Gordon's College building at Schoolhill.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 50 KG High Explosive bomb falls on Charlotte Street School.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 250 KG High Explosive bomb falls on Maberly Street.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 500 KG High Explosive bomb falls on Hutcheon Street.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 500 KG High Explosive bomb falls on Hutcheon Street central Meat Market.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 50 KG High Explosive bomb falls on Stafford Street.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: Cluster Bomb falls on Holland Street.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 500 KG High Explosive bomb falls on Richards' Works at Maberly Street.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 500 KG High Explosive bomb falls in field to south of Cairncry Road, and fails to detonate.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: Cluster bomb detonated over railway line opposite Leslie Terrace.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 500 KG High Explosive bomb falls on railway line sour of Powis Terrace.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: Cluster bomb detonates east of Kittybrewster Station.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: Phosphorus bomb detonates over railway.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 500 KG High Explosive bomb falls in grounds of Royal Infirmary, but does not detonate.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 500 KG High Explosive bomb lands in allotment north of Ashgrove Road West, but fails to detonate.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 500 KG High Explosive bomb falls in meadow north of Cornhill Road and does not detonate.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: Cluster Bomb detonates over Kintore Place and Mount Street.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: Cluster Bomb and Phosphorus bomb fall on Westburn Road.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: Cluster Bomb falls on Kilgour & Walker, Berryden Mills.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: Phosphorus Bomb falls on Northern Co-operative society building on Berryden Road.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 500 KG High Explosive bomb falls on Northern Co-operative Society bakery and bread store.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 500 KG High Explosive bomb falls in a field behind the Northern Co-operative Bakery.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: The Mental Hospital is bombed - 1 500 KG High Explosive bomb falls on the Female Ward, 1 500 KG High Explosive falls on the Female Villa, a Cluster Bomb detonates over the nurses' home, a 50 KG Phosphorus bomb strikes the outer wall of the doctors' garden, and High Explosive and Cluster bombs land in the grounds of the Hospital.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 500 KG High Explosive bomb falls on Fonthill Barracks.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 500 KG High Explosive bomb falls on Ashvale Place.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 500 KG High Explosive bomb falls on St. Mary's Church at the corner of Albert Terrace.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 500 KG High Explosive bomb falls on Craigie Park.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 50 KG High Explosive bomb falls on Anderson Drive north of King's Cross Road junction.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 250 KG High Explosive bomb falls on Kingshill Avenue.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 50 KG SC bomb dropped on Angusfield Works.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 50 KG High Explosive bomb falls on King's Cross Terrace.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 50 KG High Explosive bomb falls on Angusfield Avenue.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 8 bombs - 2 cluster bombs, 2 phosphorus, and 4 500 KG high explosive, are dropped south of the main drive at Seaton House. Two of the bombs do not detonate.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 3 500 KG High Explosive bombs, 1 phosphorus bomb, and 1 cluster bomb fall in St. Peter's Cemetery.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 500 KG High explosive bomb falls on Merkland Place.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 2 SBC 50 Cluster Bombs, 1 incendiary bomb, 1 250 KG General Purpose bomb, and 1 500 KG High Explosive bomb fall on houses in Hilton Terrace.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 500 KG High Explosive bomb falls on Cattofield Place.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: Phosphorus and Cluster bombs are dropped in the south-east corner of the Royal Mental Hospital.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 2 500 KG High Explosive bombs fall in the roadway and open fields near Westburn Drive.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 2 500 KG High Explosive bombs fall on Westburn Park. One lands on the bowling green and does not detonate.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: Phosphorus and Cluster bombs fall on the same house on Charles Street.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: Cluster bomb fails to detonate over Elmbank Terrace.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 500 KG High Explosive bomb detonates to the west of Kittybrewster Station.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: Phosphorus bomb falls on South Mount Street.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 500 KG High Explosive bomb falls in allotments at Kittybrewster.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 500 KG High Explosive bomb detonates immediately to the West of Kittybrewster Station Repair Shop.

properties.Name: 21st April 1943
properties.description: Kittybrewster Station Area: 2 500 KG bombs detonate on Kittybrewster Station ARP Shelter and the Olympia Garage.A third 500 KG High Explosive bomb detonates 280 feet South East of the Station.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description: 500 KG High Explosive bomb detonates on a house in Powis Place.

properties.Name: 21st April 1943
properties.description: 500 KG High Explosive bomb detonates after falling in a field by Long Walk Road.

properties.Name: 21st April, 1943
properties.description:
500 KG High Explosive bomb detonates after falling in a field north of Ashgrove Road West.
Location uncertain - this marked area is representative rather than definitive.

properties.Name: 21st April 1943
properties.description: 3 500 KG High Explosive bombs detonate in Stewart Park, one landing directly on Hilton Bowling Club.

properties.Name: 21st April 1943
properties.description: 2 500 KG High Explosive bombs and 1 50 KG Phosphorus bomb fall on Middlefield school.

properties.Name: 21st April 1943
properties.description: 500 KG High Explosive bomb detonates on houses at Cummings Park Road.

properties.Name: 21st April 1943
properties.description: 250 KG High Explosive bomb detonates at rear of houses on Provost Rust Drive.

properties.Name: 21st April 1943
properties.description: SBC 50 Cluster Bomb falls on house at Newton Road facing onto Danestone Circle but does not detonate.

properties.Name: 21st April 1943
properties.description: SBC 50 Cluster Bomb detonates over Smithfield Drive, 140 feet south of Fairlie Street.

properties.Name: 21st April 1943
properties.description: 50 KG Phosphorus bomb detonates on roadway at North Anderson Drive.

properties.Name: 21st April 1943
properties.description: SBC 50 Cluster bomb falls on houses on the North side of Western Road. a 500 KG High Explosive bomb detonates on the houses on the opposite side of the street.

properties.Name: 21st April 1943
properties.description: SBC 50 Cluster Bomb detonates adjacent to Gordon's Mill buildings.

properties.Name: 21st April 1943
properties.description: SBC 50 Cluster Bomb detonates in front of the Manager's House at Don Paper Mills.

properties.Name: 21st April 1943
properties.description: 500 KG SC (General Purpose) bomb falls on Ashgrove House, south of Ashgrove Road.

properties.Name: 21st April 1943
properties.description: SBC 50 Cluster bomb detonates over house on Charles Street.

properties.Name: 21st April 1943
properties.description: 50 KG bomb detonates causing damage to house in Church Street.

properties.Name: 21st April 1943
properties.description: 500 KG bomb detonates on Western Road Boys Club.

properties.Name: 21st April 1943
properties.description: SBC 50 Cluster Bomb detonates over house on Marquis Road.

properties.Name: 21st April 1943
properties.description: 500 KG bomb detonates on the East side of Summer Street.

properties.Name: 21st April 1943
properties.description: 500 KG General Purpose bomb detonates on North side of Brown Street.

properties.Name: 21st April 1943
properties.description: 500 KG bomb detonates on houses at Tanfield Walk.

properties.Name: 21st April 1943
properties.description: 250 KG bomb detonates on house at Clifton Road, and SBC 50 Cluster Bomb detonates over the junction between Clifton Road and Hilton Road.

properties.Name: 21st April 1943
properties.description: SBC 50 Cluster bomb detonates over houses on the East end of Hilton Road.

properties.Name: 21st April 1943
properties.description: 50 KG bomb hits Maberly Street Electric Sub-station but does not detonate.

properties.Name: 21st April 1943
properties.description: 50 KG bomb detonates behind a house in Charlotte Street.

properties.Name: 21st April 1943
properties.description: 250 KG bomb falls in Charles Brands' Yard in Fraser Place and SBC 50 Cluster bomb detonates over the middle of the street.

properties.Name: 21st April 1943
properties.description: SBC 50 Cluster bomb and 50 KG phosphorus bomb detonate over houses in Printfield Walk.

properties.Name: 21st April 1943
properties.description: 50 KG phosphorus bomb falls on house in Ferrier Crescent.
